section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: annual reporting period (周年報告期), in relation to an authorized institution, means a financial year of the institution; (L.N. 195 of 2016)

def.name: CapitalRequirements
def.leadIn: capital requirements (資本規定), in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the measure of an authorized institution’s non-securitization exposures to credit risk calculated in accordance with any one or more of Parts 4, 5 and 6 and Division 4 of Part 6A of the Capital Rules, as the case requires; (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the measure of an authorized institution’s securitization exposures to credit risk calculated in accordance with Part 7 of the Capital Rules; and (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the measure of an authorized institution’s sovereign concentration risk calculated in accordance with Part 10 of the Capital Rules, (L.N. 168 of 2023)

subsection.def: Capital Rules (《資本規則》) means the Banking (Capital) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. L);
CB ratio (CB比率) has the meaning given by section 3E(1) of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 77 of 2018)
CCyB ratio (CCyB比率) has the meaning given by section 3E(1) of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 77 of 2018)
certificate of deposit (存款證) means any certificate of deposit (including a certificate of deposit held for trading purposes) regardless of maturity;
debt securities (債務證券) means any negotiable securities other than loan capital, shares, stocks, certificates of deposit or import or export trade bills; (L.N. 52 of 2013)
delta-weighted position (得爾塔加權持倉) has the meaning assigned to it by section 281 of the Capital Rules;

def.name: DisclosureStatement
def.leadIn: disclosure statement (披露報表), in relation to an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means, except in Part 8, a disclosure statement prepared by the institution pursuant to section 6(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: means, in Part 8, a disclosure statement prepared by the institution pursuant to section 88(1);

subsection.def: exposure measure (風險承擔計量) has the meaning given by section 3Y of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

def.name: FinancialConcerns
def.leadIn: financial concerns (金融企業) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: investment companies including—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: unit trusts;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: retirement funds; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: investment holding companies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: insurance companies;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: futures brokers; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: finance companies and other persons engaged in the financial sector which are not authorized institutions or banks, including companies in the business of leasing, factoring, bills discounting, hire purchase, mortgage finance, commercial and industrial finance, gold bullion brokers, money lenders, pawnshops and credit card companies;

subsection.def: foreign currency (非港元貨幣) means any currency other than the Hong Kong dollar;
G-SIB has the meaning given by section 3E(1) of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

def.name: GeographicalSegment
def.leadIn: geographical segment (地域分部), in relation to an authorized institution, means a business unit of the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is engaged in providing products or services within a particular economic environment;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: which is distinct from other business units of the institution due to factors relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: similarity of economic and political conditions;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: relationships between operations in different geographical areas;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: proximity of operations;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: special risks associated with operations in a particular area;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: exchange control regulations;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: underlying currency risks; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: any combination of the matters referred to in subparagraphs (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v) and (vi);

subsection.def: HLA ratio (HLA比率) has the meaning given by section 3E(1) of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 77 of 2018)
interim reporting period (中期報告期), in relation to an authorized institution, means the first 6 months of a financial year of the institution; (L.N. 195 of 2016)
leverage ratio (槓桿比率) has the meaning given by section 3Y of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 77 of 2018)
leverage ratio return (槓桿比率申報表) means the standard return template relating to leverage ratio referred to in section 3ZB(3) of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

liquidity position return (流動性狀況申報表) means the return relating to liquidity position required to be submitted by an authorized institution to the Monetary Authority under section 63(2) of the Ordinance; (L.N. 160 of 2014)
Liquidity Rules (《流動性規則》) means the Banking (Liquidity) Rules (Cap. 155 sub. leg. Q); (L.N. 160 of 2014; E.R. 5 of 2021)
loan capital (借貸資本) means subordinated liabilities (including loans, debentures and floating rate notes);
loans and advances to banks (對銀行的貸款及放款) means placements with banks which have a residual contractual maturity of more than one year;

off-balance sheet exposures (資產負債表外風險承擔), in relation to the leverage ratio of an authorized institution, means the off-balance sheet exposures calculated by using the standard calculation methodology set out in the leverage ratio return; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

on-balance sheet exposures (資產負債表內風險承擔), in relation to the leverage ratio of an authorized institution, means the on-balance sheet exposures calculated by using the standard calculation methodology set out in the leverage ratio return; (L.N. 77 of 2018)
publish (發布) includes distribute, make available and disseminate;
quarterly reporting period (季度報告期), in relation to an authorized institution, means the first, second, third or fourth 3-month period of a financial year of the institution; (L.N. 195 of 2016)
reporting date (報告日期), in relation to a disclosure required under these Rules, means the last day of the reporting period to which the disclosure relates;

def.name: ReportingPeriod
def.leadIn: reporting period (報告期) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an annual reporting period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a semi-annual reporting period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a quarterly reporting period; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an interim reporting period; (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.def: repossessed asset (經收回資產), in relation to an authorized institution, means an asset in respect of which the institution has acquired control (whether through court proceedings or otherwise) for the discharge in whole or in part of the obligations of an obligor;
semi-annual reporting period (半年度報告期), in relation to an authorized institution, means the first or second 6-month period of a financial year of the institution; (L.N. 195 of 2016)

stable funding position return (穩定資金狀況申報表) means the return relating to stable funding position required to be submitted by an authorized institution to the Monetary Authority under section 63(2) of the Ordinance; (L.N. 77 of 2018)
trade bills (貿易匯票), in relation to an authorized institution, means all bills of exchange purchased by the institution in relation to trade transactions.

subsection.content: Section 2 of the Capital Rules applies to the interpretation of these Rules as that section applies to the interpretation of the Capital Rules. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Rules 2, 17, 39, 54 and 59 of the Liquidity Rules, if applicable, apply to the interpretation of sections 12, 16AB, 16FJ, 16FK, 16FL, 103, 103A, 103AB, 103B and 103C of these Rules as those rules apply to the interpretation of the Liquidity Rules. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: If a conflict arises from the operation of subsections (2) and (2A) in relation to the interpretation of these Rules, the rule that applies under subsection (2A) prevails. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: A disclosure required under these Rules is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a disclosure to the general public; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the context otherwise requires, a disclosure as at the reporting date.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Unless otherwise approved by the Monetary Authority, if the commencement date of any section, or of any amendment of any section, falls within a reporting period, an authorized institution must comply with that section, or that section as amended, as the case requires, in respect of the required disclosure for the reporting period. (L.N. 168 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of these Rules, a reference to an authorized institution making a disclosure to the general public includes the institution making the disclosure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the institution’s internet website (or a section of the internet website); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if approved by the Monetary Authority—on the internet website of the institution’s holding company (or a section of the internet website of the institution’s holding company). (L.N. 77 of 2018; L.N. 168 of 2023)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 12, the following provisions apply to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong unless it is exempted under subsection (7) or (14A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part 2;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provisions of Part 2A requiring disclosures for each annual reporting period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following provisions, in so far as they relate to a quarterly or semi-annual reporting period (as the case requires) that ends at the close of an annual reporting period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: provisions of Part 2A requiring disclosures for each quarterly or semi-annual reporting period;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: Part 3;

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 12, the following provisions apply to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong unless it is exempted under subsection (8) or (14A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following provisions, in so far as they relate to a quarterly or semi-annual reporting period (as the case requires) that ends otherwise than at the close of an annual reporting period—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: provisions of Part 2A requiring disclosures for each quarterly or semi-annual reporting period;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: Part 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Part 3A. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.content: Part 8 applies to an authorized institution incorporated outside Hong Kong except such an institution which is exempted under subsection (9) or (14A). (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong, exempt the institution from the application of the provisions specified in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) and (d) if— (L.N. 195 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution is a deposit-taking company or restricted licence bank; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it meets the following criteria—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it has total assets less provisions of less than $1 billion (or the equivalent amount in any foreign currency); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it has total deposits from customers of less than $300 million (or the equivalent amount in any foreign currency).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong, exempt the institution from the application of the provisions specified in subsection (2)(a) and (b) if— (L.N. 195 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution is exempted under subsection (7) from the application of the provisions specified in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) and (d); or (L.N. 195 of 2016)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is not listed on The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is a wholly owned subsidiary of an authorized institution incorporated in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (6), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to an authorized institution incorporated outside Hong Kong, exempt the institution from the application of Part 8 if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that it meets the following criteria—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its local branches, together with its principal place of business in Hong Kong, have in aggregate total assets less provisions of less than $10 billion (or the equivalent amount in any foreign currency); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its local branches, together with its principal place of business in Hong Kong, have in aggregate total deposits from customers of less than $2 billion (or the equivalent amount in any foreign currency).

subsection.content: For the purposes of determining whether or not an authorized institution meets the criteria referred to in subsection (7)(b) or (9), the Monetary Authority shall make reference to the relevant average of the relevant figures over the relevant period of the institution.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Monetary Authority has determined that an authorized institution is not exempted under subsection (7) because the institution does not meet the criteria referred to in subsection (7)(b), the institution shall not subsequently be exempted under subsection (7) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority makes a subsequent determination that the institution is exempted under subsection (7); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the institution submits to the Monetary Authority a business plan, within a period reasonable in all the circumstances of the case, which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that, if the plan were implemented by the institution, it would be unlikely that the institution would cease to meet the criteria referred to in subsection (7)(b) during the period referred to in subparagraph (ii); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: covers such an appropriate period in the future that the Monetary Authority is satisfied that it would be unlikely that the institution would cease to meet the criteria referred to in subsection (7)(b) in the foreseeable future.

subsection.content: Where the Monetary Authority is satisfied that an authorized institution which is exempted under subsection (7) ceases to fall within the description of subsection (7)(a) or ceases to meet the criteria referred to in subsection (7)(b), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, inform the institution that it ceases to be so exempted from the date specified in the notice.

Where the Monetary Authority is satisfied that an authorized institution which is exempted under subsection (8) ceases to fall within the description of subsection (8)(a) or (b), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, inform the institution that it ceases to be so exempted from the date specified in the notice.

Where the Monetary Authority is satisfied that an authorized institution which is exempted under subsection (9) ceases to meet the criteria referred to in that subsection, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, inform the institution that it ceases to be so exempted from the date specified in the notice.

subsection.name: 14A
subsection.content: The Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to an authorized institution, exempt the institution from the application of these Rules if the Monetary Authority is satisfied that the institution has not commenced business. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.name: 14A
subsection.content: If the Monetary Authority is satisfied that an authorized institution which is exempted under subsection (14A) has commenced business, the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to the institution, inform the institution that it ceases to be so exempted from the date specified in the notice. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant average (有關平均數), in relation to the relevant figures for an authorized institution, means the arithmetic mean of the relevant figures as at the end of each calendar month for the last relevant period of the institution;

relevant figures (有關數字), in relation to an authorized institution, means the figures as at the end of each calendar month relating to the institution’s total assets less provisions and total deposits from customers, as set out in the return relating to assets and liabilities submitted by the institution to the Monetary Authority for each calendar month pursuant to section 63 of the Ordinance;

relevant period (有關期間), in relation to an authorized institution, means each period of 12 calendar months ending on and including the fifth calendar month preceding the close of the institution’s financial year.

part.name: P2
part.heading: General Requirements for Authorized Institutions Incorporated in Hong Kong

section.name: s4
section.heading: References to authorized institution in Part 2
section.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to an authorized institution in this Part is a reference to an authorized institution to which this Part applies under section 3(1).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Disclosure policy
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must have in place, within 6 months after the date on which it became an authorized institution or such longer period as the Monetary Authority may specify, a clearly documented disclosure policy— (L.N. 195 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: which sets out—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the approach used by the institution—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to determine the content, appropriateness and frequency of the information it discloses to the general public relating to its state of affairs, including its profit and loss and its financial resources (including capital resources and liquidity resources); and (L.N. 52 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to ensure that such information it discloses is relevant and adequate to convey an accurate impression of the institution’s actual risk profile; and (L.N. 138 of 2011)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the institution’s internal controls over its process for making such disclosures (including internal controls for verifying or reviewing the accuracy of the information disclosed); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is subject to regular and independent review and approval by the institution’s senior management and board of directors. (L.N. 168 of 2023)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Medium, location and timing of disclosure

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 16FE(1)(b) and (2), if an authorized institution is required under these Rules to disclose information (however described), it must make that disclosure by— (L.N. 52 of 2013; L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: preparing, in the Chinese and English languages, a disclosure statement— (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subparagraph.content: that, subject to subsection (1A) and section 15, is in the form exclusively of a standalone document or a discrete section of the institution’s financial statements; and
in which the information required to be disclosed is readily identifiable; (L.N. 195 of 2016)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (1A) and section 15, presenting the information required to be disclosed in the format, and using the standard disclosure templates or tables (if applicable), specified by the Monetary Authority; and (L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complying with the other provisions of this section applicable to or in relation to the statement.

subsection.content: If it is so permitted by the Monetary Authority in specification under subsection (1)(ab) and if all the conditions specified in subsection (1B) are met, any part of the information required to be disclosed may be contained in a separate document that is signposted in the standalone document or the discrete section of the authorized institution’s financial statements (discrete section). (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the authorized institution signposts clearly, in the standalone document or the discrete section, the location where the information published elsewhere is published, providing, at a minimum, the following information—

subparagraph.content: a reference to the format and templates specified by the Monetary Authority to which the signposting relates;
the full title of the separate document in which the information is published;
a link to the relevant section of the institution’s internet website where the separate document can be accessed (if applicable); and (L.N. 77 of 2018)
the page and paragraph number of the separate document where the information is located; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the level of assurance on the reliability of data in the separate document is equivalent to, or greater than, the internal assurance level required for the information presented in the standalone document or the discrete section. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: For disclosures under Part 2A for a quarterly reporting period that ends otherwise than at the close of an interim or annual reporting period, the authorized institution must publish the disclosure statement— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the authorized institution publishes its quarterly financial statements for the quarterly reporting period (quarterly financial statements) within 8 weeks after the end of the quarterly reporting period—concurrently with the publication of the quarterly financial statements; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the authorized institution does not publish the quarterly financial statements within 8 weeks after the end of the quarterly reporting period—within that 8-week period. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: For disclosures under Part 2A, 3 or 3A for a reporting period that is, or ends at the close of, an interim reporting period, the authorized institution must publish the disclosure statement— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the authorized institution publishes its interim financial statements for the interim reporting period (interim financial statements) within 3 months after the end of the quarterly, semi-annual or interim reporting period to which the disclosure statement relates (specified reporting period)— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: concurrently with the publication of the interim financial statements; or
if a permission is given under subsection (1F)—within the time permitted; or (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the authorized institution does not publish the interim financial statements within 3 months after the end of the specified reporting period—within that 3-month period. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.leadIn: For disclosures under Part 2A, 3 or 4 for a reporting period that is, or ends at the close of, an annual reporting period, the authorized institution must publish the disclosure statement— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the authorized institution publishes its annual financial statements for the annual reporting period (annual financial statements) within 4 months after the end of the quarterly, semi-annual or annual reporting period to which the disclosure statement relates (specified reporting period)— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: concurrently with the publication of the annual financial statements; or
if a permission is given under subsection (1F)—within the time permitted; or (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the authorized institution does not publish the annual financial statements within 4 months after the end of the specified reporting period—within that 4-month period. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1F
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (1G), the Monetary Authority may, by notice in writing given to an authorized institution, permit the publication of a disclosure statement under subsection (1D)(a) or (1E)(a) by the institution at a time later than the publication of the interim financial statements or annual financial statements (as the case requires) but within the following period after the end of the reporting period to which the disclosure statement relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if subsection (1D)(a) applies—3 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (1E)(a) applies—4 months. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.name: 1G
subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may give a permission under subsection (1F) if the authorized institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: concurrent publication under subsection (1D)(a)(i) or (1E)(a)(i) is not practicable or feasible, or will result in a delay in the publication of the relevant financial statements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proposed difference in time between the publication of the relevant financial statements and the publication of the disclosure statement is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall make it clear in its disclosure statement which information contained in the statement has been audited and which information contained in the statement has not been audited.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must ensure that when its disclosure statement is published—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the statement contains all the disclosures required under these Rules to be made by the institution for the reporting periods to which the statement relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosures referred to in paragraph (a) are not false or misleading in any material respect. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must ensure that when its disclosure statement for an annual reporting period is published, the statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: describes the key elements of its disclosure policy referred to in section 5; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provides a cross-reference to another location where the description referred to in paragraph (a) is readily accessible by the general public. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall lodge a copy of its disclosure statement with the Monetary Authority before it publishes the statement.
The Monetary Authority shall keep each copy of a disclosure statement lodged with it pursuant to subsection (5) with the register.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (8), an authorized institution shall— (L.N. 195 of 2016)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep at least one copy of each of its disclosure statements (relevant copy) in its principal place of business in Hong Kong; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a relevant copy available for inspection by the general public during the business hours of the institution at its principal place of business in Hong Kong. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.content: If an authorized institution publishes a disclosure statement containing the disclosures referred to in subsection (3)(a), it must ensure that the statement is available for inspection under subsection (7) for at least 12 months beginning on the date of publication of the statement. (L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.name: 10A
subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must establish and maintain an archive of all disclosure statements relating to reporting periods ending on or after 30 June 2013; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: unless otherwise approved by the Monetary Authority, must establish and maintain the archive—

subparagraph.content: on the institution’s internet website; or
if an approval is given under section 2(4)(b)—on the internet website of the institution’s holding company. (L.N. 77 of 2018; L.N. 168 of 2023)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Verification

subsection.content: The board of directors (or a committee designated by the board) and the senior management of an authorized institution shall ensure that the information which the institution is required to disclose pursuant to these Rules is, before being so disclosed, scrutinized and subjected to an internal review to ensure that the information is not false or misleading in any material respect. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

The internal review referred to in subsection (1) shall be carried out by an authorized institution’s adequately qualified personnel who are independent of the institution’s staff or management responsible for preparing the information which the institution is required to disclose pursuant to these Rules.

An authorized institution must ensure that one or more members of the senior management of the institution attest in writing that the disclosures made by the institution pursuant to these Rules have been prepared in accordance with the internal review and internal control processes approved by the institution’s board of directors. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

The internal review and internal control processes applied to the information disclosed by an authorized institution under these Rules for a reporting period that is, or ends at the close of, an interim or annual reporting period must be no less stringent than those applied to the information provided by the institution within the management discussion and analysis part of its financial statements. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Proprietary and confidential information

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution may, with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority, decline to disclose proprietary or confidential information the disclosure of which would otherwise be required pursuant to a requirement of these Rules (referred to in this subsection as the relevant requirement) if the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: discloses general information relating to the subject matter of the relevant requirement in its disclosure statement (whether or not pursuant to the relevant requirement); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes a statement in that disclosure statement stating what information it has declined to disclose pursuant to this section.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ProprietaryOrConfidentialInformation
def.leadIn: proprietary or confidential information (專有或機密資料), in relation to an authorized institution, means information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which, if it became publicly available, would cause serious prejudice to the competitive position of the institution; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of which the institution has legally binding obligations to its customers or other counterparties which prevent the institution from disclosing the information.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Materiality

subsection.content: The senior management of an authorized institution shall ensure that a disclosure made by the institution pursuant to these Rules contains all the material information.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: MaterialInformation
def.leadIn: material information (重要資料) means information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is required to be disclosed under these Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which, if it were not disclosed or were misstated, could change or influence the assessment or decision of a person relying on the disclosure concerned for the purposes of making investment or other economic decisions.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Consolidated group level disclosures

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5), a disclosure made pursuant to these Rules by an authorized institution applies to the institution on a consolidated basis whether or not the institution is also required to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo basis or solo-consolidated basis pursuant to the Capital Rules.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an authorized institution which is only required to calculate its capital adequacy ratio on a solo basis pursuant to the Capital Rules.

Subsection (1) does not operate to prevent an authorized institution from making a disclosure pursuant to these Rules on a solo basis or solo-consolidated basis, as the case requires, in addition to a consolidated basis if the institution reasonably believes that to do so would provide greater clarity in understanding the institution’s state of affairs, including its profit and loss and its financial resources (including capital resources and liquidity resources), for persons relying on the disclosures. (L.N. 52 of 2013)

Subsection (1) does not apply to disclosures required to be made by an authorized institution pursuant to section 16FJ, 16FK, 16FL, 23, 25, 26, 27, 28, 29, 29B, 35, 44, 46, 47 or 52. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

Subject to subsection (6), a disclosure required to be made by an authorized institution pursuant to any of the sections set out in subsection (4) must be made on the basis of preparation (whether fully consolidated or unconsolidated) which the institution believes is most appropriate for the purposes of providing clarity in understanding the institution’s state of affairs, including its profit and loss and its financial resources (including capital resources and liquidity resources), for persons relying on the disclosures required by those sections, including (where appropriate) the basis used by the institution for accounting purposes for the reporting period to which the disclosure relates. (L.N. 52 of 2013; L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

A disclosure required to be made by an authorized institution pursuant to any of sections 16FJ, 16FK, 16FL, 28 and 29 must be made on the same basis as that used by the institution to prepare the return respectively referred to in those sections. (L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Basis of disclosure

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall make disclosures pursuant to these Rules on the basis of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), the approach it uses under the Capital Rules to calculate its regulatory capital or capital charge for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk or operational risk, as the case requires;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), if it uses a combination of 2 or more approaches under the Capital Rules to calculate its regulatory capital or capital charge for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk or operational risk, the respective approach it uses for each of its exposure classes, business units, risk categories, or parts of its business, as the case requires;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if it has, during any one reporting period, used different approaches under the Capital Rules to calculate its regulatory capital or capital charge for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk or operational risk for the same exposure class, business unit, risk category, or part of its business, the respective approach it uses for each of its exposure classes, business units, risk categories, or parts of its business, as the case requires, as at the reporting date for that period. (L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 168 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution is exempted, under the Capital Rules, from the requirement to calculate its capital requirements or capital charge for its credit risk, market risk, CVA risk or operational risk (as the case requires), the institution— (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not required to make disclosures pertaining to the approach; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must disclose that fact. (L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution is not required, under the Liquidity Rules, to calculate one or more of the LCR, LMR, NSFR or CFR (excluded ratios) for its liquidity risk, the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not required to make disclosures pertaining to the excluded ratios; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must disclose that fact. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Frequency

subsection.content: An authorized institution must make disclosures pursuant to Part 2A for each annual, semi-annual and quarterly reporting period, as that Part requires.
An authorized institution must make disclosures pursuant to Part 3 for each semi-annual reporting period. (L.N. 77 of 2018)
An authorized institution must make disclosures pursuant to Part 3A for each interim reporting period.
An authorized institution must make disclosures pursuant to Part 4 for each annual reporting period.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Group-wide disclosures made by parent bank of authorized institution
section.leadIn: An authorized institution may treat disclosures (referred to in this section as foreign disclosures) made by its parent bank, if any, as being part of the disclosures (referred to in this section as local disclosures) the institution is required to make pursuant to these Rules if the institution demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Monetary Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the foreign disclosures are not materially different from the local disclosures;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the foreign disclosures are prepared in accordance with the prevailing banking supervisory standards relating to disclosure issued by the Basel Committee and adopted by the relevant banking supervisory authority of the parent bank; (L.N. 52 of 2013)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the foreign disclosures provide a sufficient level of detail on the range of risks incurred by the institution and on how those risks are managed to permit third parties to form a considered view of the relevant aspects of the institution’s operations;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disclosure statement of the institution contains a statement of the location where all the foreign disclosures can be found;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the foreign disclosures are set out on an internet website of the parent bank which is accessible by the general public; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the institution has an internet website (or section of an internet website) which— (L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

subparagraph.content: is specifically intended to be accessible by the general public in Hong Kong; and
contains a link to the section of the parent bank’s internet website setting out the foreign disclosures as referred to in paragraph (f). (L.N. 195 of 2016; L.N. 77 of 2018)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Compliance

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, in addition to the disclosures it is required to make pursuant to any other provisions of these Rules, include in its disclosure statement such other information that it is necessary to so include to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information contained in the statement is not false or misleading in any material respect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the operations of the institution are clearly explained.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions of these Rules, where it is not practicable for an authorized institution to make a disclosure required under these Rules for reasons not related to section 9, the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall, after consultation with the Monetary Authority, include in its disclosure statement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a statement that it is so unable and of the reasons why it is so unable; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: information which is the closest available alternative to the information which would have been the subject of those disclosures if the institution had not been so unable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not publish the disclosure statement except with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority.

part.name: P2A
part.heading: Specific Disclosures to be Made by Authorized Institutions Incorporated in Hong Kong

section.name: s16A
section.heading: References to authorized institution in Part 2A
section.leadIn: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to an authorized institution in a provision of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: requiring—

subparagraph.content: disclosures for an annual reporting period; or
disclosures for a quarterly or semi-annual reporting period, in so far as the provision relates to such a period that ends at the close of an annual reporting period,

paragraph.continued: is a reference to an authorized institution to which the provision applies under section 3(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring disclosures for a quarterly or semi-annual reporting period, in so far as the provision relates to such a period that ends otherwise than at the close of an annual reporting period, is a reference to an authorized institution to which the provision applies under section 3(2).

division.name: D2
division.heading: Key Prudential Ratios and Overview of Risk Management and Risk-weighted Amount

section.name: s16AB
section.heading: Key prudential ratios—quarterly disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period (relevant reporting period)— (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: each of the following ratios that it is required to calculate for the purposes of the Capital Rules or the Liquidity Rules (as applicable) (each referred to in this section as a key prudential ratio)—

subparagraph.content: CET1 capital ratio;
Tier 1 capital ratio;
Total capital ratio;

subparagraph.name: 3a
subparagraph.content: pre-floor capital ratios; (L.N. 168 of 2023)
leverage ratio;

subparagraph.name: 4a
subparagraph.content: mean-SFT adjusted leverage ratio; (L.N. 168 of 2023)
LCR;
LMR;
NSFR;
CFR;
CB ratio;
CCyB ratio;
HLA ratio;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: for each key prudential ratio—comparative figures for each of the 4 quarterly reporting periods before the relevant reporting period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for each key prudential ratio—an explanation of any material changes during the relevant reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: mean-SFT adjusted leverage ratio (經調整平均證券融資交易槓桿比率), in relation to an authorized institution, means a ratio determined in the same way as the institution’s leverage ratio, except that the institution’s exposures arising from SFTs used in the calculation of the exposure measure are based on the arithmetic mean of the gross amount of SFT assets (after adjustment for sale accounting transactions and netted amounts of associated cash payables and cash receivables) as of each day of the quarterly reporting period;

pre-floor capital ratios (下限前資本比率), in relation to an authorized institution, means the pre-floor CET1 capital ratio, the pre-floor Tier 1 capital ratio and the pre-floor Total capital ratio that are determined in the same way as the institution’s CET1 capital ratio, Tier 1 capital ratio and Total capital ratio under subsection (1)(a)(i), (ii) and (iii) respectively, except that the risk-weighted amount used for calculating the pre-floor ratios excludes any adjustments required for meeting the output floor requirement specified in Part 11 of the Capital Rules. (L.N. 168 of 2023)

section.name: s16B
section.heading: Overview of risk management—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, a description of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its risk management objectives and policies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how the board of directors and senior management of the institution assess and manage risks,

section.continued: that is necessary or relevant for understanding its risk tolerance or appetite in relation to its main activities and all significant risks inherent in or associated with those activities. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

section.name: s16C
section.heading: Overview of risk-weighted amount—quarterly disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an overview of its capital requirements by providing a breakdown of its total risk-weighted amount forming the denominator of the capital requirements; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the quarterly reporting period.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Linkages between Financial Statements and Regulatory Exposures

section.name: s16D
section.heading: Differences between accounting and regulatory scopes of consolidation and mapping of financial statement categories with regulatory risk categories—annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, information on its assets and liabilities that is necessary or relevant for identifying the differences between— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scope of accounting consolidation applicable to the institution; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scope of regulatory consolidation applicable to the institution.

subsection.content: The disclosure under subsection (1) must include a breakdown into regulatory risk categories of every item of the assets and liabilities reported in the institution’s financial statements based on the scope of accounting consolidation applicable to the institution.

section.name: s16E
section.heading: Main sources of differences between regulatory exposure amounts and carrying values in financial statements—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, information on the main sources of differences between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the carrying value amounts in its financial statements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exposure amounts used to calculate its capital requirements,

section.continued: in respect of its assets and liabilities based on the scope of regulatory consolidation applicable to the institution.

section.name: s16F
section.heading: Explanations of differences between accounting and regulatory exposure amounts—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, qualitative explanations of the differences disclosed under sections 16D and 16E.

section.name: s16FA
section.heading: Prudent valuation adjustments—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of prudent valuation adjustments required by type of financial instruments, and allocation of these adjustments between the banking book and the trading book (if applicable); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the amount of prudent valuation adjustments referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16FB
section.heading: Composition of regulatory capital—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of the constituent elements of its Total capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16FC
section.heading: Reconciliation of regulatory capital to balance sheet—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a full reconciliation between—

subparagraph.content: the composition of its regulatory capital; and
its balance sheet in its published financial statements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16FD
section.heading: Scope of consolidation—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the basis of consolidation including—

subparagraph.content: an outline of the differences between the accounting scope of consolidation and the regulatory scope of consolidation;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the institution’s subsidiaries (if any) that are included in the accounting scope of consolidation but not included in the regulatory scope of consolidation;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the institution’s subsidiaries (if any) that are included in the regulatory scope of consolidation but not included in the accounting scope of consolidation; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the institution’s subsidiaries (if any) that are included in both the accounting scope of consolidation and the regulatory scope of consolidation if the methods of consolidation differ between those 2 scopes, and an explanation of the differences in the 2 methods of consolidation;
if the institution’s shareholdings in any of its subsidiaries are deducted from the institution’s CET1 capital—a list of those subsidiaries; and

a description of the principal activities of each of the subsidiaries mentioned in subparagraphs (ii)(A), (B) and (C) and (iii), including the amount of total assets and the amount of total equity reported in the financial statements of each subsidiary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any restrictions, or other major impediments, on the transfer of funds or regulatory capital between the members of the institution’s consolidation group, including any relevant regulatory, legal or taxation constraints on the transfer of funds or capital.

section.name: s16FE
section.heading: Main features of regulatory capital instruments—semi-annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the main features of the CET1 capital instruments, Additional Tier 1 capital instruments and Tier 2 capital instruments issued by it, as applicable, that are included in its regulatory capital (each referred to in this section as a relevant instrument); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a direct link to the relevant section of its internet website where the full terms and conditions of all relevant instruments can be found.

subsection.leadIn: Whenever—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a relevant instrument—

subparagraph.content: is issued and included in an authorized institution’s capital base;
is repaid; or
is excluded from an authorized institution’s capital base; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a redemption, conversion or write-down, or any other material change in the nature, of a relevant instrument included in an authorized institution’s capital base,

subsection.continued: the institution must, as soon as practicable, update the disclosures it has made under subsection (1) in order to reflect the changes arising from the event referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

section.name: s16FF
section.heading: G-SIB indicators—annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an authorized institution if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is or has been designated under section 3S of the Capital Rules as a G-SIB either in—

subparagraph.content: the current annual reporting period; or
the annual reporting period immediately preceding the current annual reporting period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a direction is given to it under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may give a direction to an authorized institution for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution or, if applicable, its consolidation group and any subsidiaries of the institution that are not included in the consolidation group but are insurance firms had, as at 31 December immediately preceding the current annual reporting period, an exposure measure exceeding Euro 200 billion or equivalent (using the exchange rate for that day as prescribed by the Basel Committee); or (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority, having regard to the characteristics of the institution, reasonably believes that the institution would be capable of having a significant impact on the effective working and stability of the global financial system were the institution to become non-viable.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose an overview of the indicators regarding its systemic importance as specified in subsection (4) for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the annual reporting period immediately preceding the current annual reporting period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if permitted by the Monetary Authority—the current annual reporting period.

subsection.leadIn: The indicators are, if applicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the authorized institution’s cross-jurisdictional activities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its size;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the interconnectedness between the institution and other financial institutions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: its substitutability, including its role in the financial institution infrastructure; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: its complexity.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must base its disclosures on the position as at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the end of the annual reporting period immediately preceding the current annual reporting period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if permitted by the Monetary Authority—another date.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized institution, having made disclosures under subsection (3) for a reporting period, restates the figures for the indicators specified in subsection (4) on the Monetary Authority’s direction or on its own volition, the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must make an additional disclosure to reflect the restated figures as soon as practicable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must disclose, in the disclosure statement relating to the reporting period in which the restatement is made, the fact of the restatement and the restated figures.

section.name: s16FG
section.heading: Geographical distribution of credit exposures used in countercyclical capital buffer—semi-annual disclosures

subsection.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period, an overview of the geographical distribution of its private sector credit exposures that are relevant in the calculation of its CCyB ratio.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: private sector credit exposures (私人機構信用風險承擔) has the meaning given by section 3N of the Capital Rules.

section.name: s16FH
section.heading: Summary comparison of accounting assets against leverage ratio exposure measure—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a summary comparison reconciling the institution’s balance sheet assets as stated in its financial statements with the exposure measure for the corresponding period disclosed under section 16FI; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16FI
section.heading: Leverage ratio—quarterly disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period— (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following information—

subparagraph.content: its leverage ratio;
the minimum leverage ratio applicable to it;
a breakdown of the components of the exposure measure determined in accordance with section 3ZB of the Capital Rules;
the mean-SFT adjusted leverage ratio;
the denominator, including the mean value of gross assets of SFTs, used in the calculation of the mean-SFT adjusted leverage ratio referred to in subparagraph (iv); (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes; and (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material differences between the gross amount of SFT assets that are used in the calculation of the leverage ratio referred to in paragraph (a)(i) and the mean value of gross assets of SFTs specified under paragraph (a)(v). (L.N. 168 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: mean-SFT adjusted leverage ratio (經調整平均證券融資交易槓桿比率) has the meaning given by section 16AB(2). (L.N. 168 of 2023)

section.name: s16FJ
section.heading: Liquidity risk management—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, information relating to the institution’s approach to liquidity risk management that is necessary or relevant for facilitating an understanding of the soundness of its liquidity risk management framework and liquidity position.

section.name: s16FK
section.heading: Liquidity coverage ratio—quarterly disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution that is a category 1 institution must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following as calculated based on the calculation methodology and instructions set out in the liquidity position return—

subparagraph.content: the details of its LCR;
its HQLA;
a breakdown of the total net cash outflows; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sufficient qualitative explanation for facilitating an understanding of its LCR calculation.

section.name: s16FL
section.heading: Net stable funding ratio—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution that is a category 1 institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following as calculated based on the calculation methodology and instructions set out in the stable funding position return—

subparagraph.content: the details of its NSFR;
a breakdown of its ASF and RSF; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sufficient qualitative explanation for facilitating an understanding of its NSFR calculation.

section.name: s16G
section.heading: General information about credit risk—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, the main characteristics and elements of its credit risk management, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its business model;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its credit risk profile; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its organization and functions involved in credit risk management and risk management reporting.

section.name: s16H
section.heading: Credit quality of exposures—semi-annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period, an overview of the credit quality of its on-balance sheet exposures and off-balance sheet exposures.

section.name: s16I
section.heading: Changes in defaulted loans and debt securities—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the changes in its defaulted loans and debt securities, including—

subparagraph.content: any changes in the amounts of defaulted exposures;
any movement between defaulted and non-defaulted exposures; and
any reductions in the defaulted exposures due to write-offs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16J
section.heading: Additional disclosures related to credit quality of exposures—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, additional qualitative and quantitative information on the credit quality of its exposures to supplement the information disclosed under sections 16H and 16I.

section.name: s16K
section.heading: Qualitative disclosures related to credit risk mitigation—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, qualitative information on its policies and processes relating to the use of credit risk mitigation.

section.name: s16L
section.heading: Overview of recognized credit risk mitigation—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the extent of credit risk exposures covered by different types of recognized credit risk mitigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16M
section.heading: Qualitative disclosures on use of ECAI ratings under STC approach—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the STC approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each annual reporting period, information on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the process it adopts for using ECAI ratings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extent to which the ratings are used for its risk-weighted amount calculation.

section.name: s16N
section.heading: STC approach or BSC approach: credit risk exposures and effects of recognized credit risk mitigation—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the STC approach or the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the effects of any recognized credit risk mitigation (including recognized collateral based on the comprehensive approach or the simple approach or both) on the calculation of its capital requirements under the STC approach or the BSC approach (as the case requires); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the effects referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16O
section.heading: STC approach or BSC approach: credit risk exposures by exposure classes and by risk-weights—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the STC approach or the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of credit risk exposures by exposure classes and by risk-weights corresponding to the categorization of exposures according to the STC approach or the BSC approach (as the case requires); and (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the exposures referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16P
section.heading: Qualitative disclosures related to internal models for measuring credit risk under IRB approach—annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: additional information on its internal models used to calculate the risk-weighted amount for credit risk, describing the main characteristics of the models used at the group-wide level (according to the scope of regulatory consolidation applicable to the institution); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of how the scope of the models described is determined.

subsection.content: The disclosures must include the percentage of risk-weighted amounts covered by the models for each of the institution’s regulatory portfolios.

section.name: s16Q
section.heading: IRB approach: credit risk exposures by portfolio and PD ranges—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the main parameters of its internal models used for the calculation of capital requirements; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16R
section.heading: IRB approach: effects on risk-weighted amount of recognized credit derivative contracts used as recognized credit risk mitigation—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the effects of recognized credit derivative contracts on the calculation of its risk-weighted amounts under the IRB approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of the effects referred to in paragraph (a).

section.name: s16S
section.heading: Risk-weighted amount flow statements of credit risk exposures under IRB approach—quarterly disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a flow statement explaining changes in the risk-weighted amount for credit risk determined under the IRB approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the risk-weighted amount referred to in paragraph (a) during the quarterly reporting period.

section.name: s16T
section.heading: IRB approach: back-testing of PD per portfolio—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: back-testing data to validate the reliability of PD calculations, including a comparison of the PD used to calculate capital requirements with the effective default rates of the obligors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the annual reporting period.

section.name: s16U
section.heading: IRB approach: specialized lending under supervisory slotting criteria approach—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: quantitative information in respect of its specialized lending under the supervisory slotting criteria approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matter referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16V
section.heading: Qualitative disclosures related to counterparty credit risk (including those arising from clearing through CCPs)—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a description of its counterparty credit risk management objectives and policies, including those related to—

subparagraph.content: the setting of operating limits;
the use of guarantees and other forms of credit risk mitigation;
the risk that arises when the probability of default of counterparties is positively correlated with general market risk factors; and
the specific wrong-way risk as defined by section 226A of the Capital Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the impact on the institution in terms of the amount of collateral that it would have to provide if there were a downgrade in its credit rating.

section.name: s16W
section.heading: Analysis of counterparty credit risk exposures, other than those to CCPs, by approaches—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of default risk exposures (other than those to CCPs), risk-weighted amounts and, where applicable, main parameters used, under the approaches used by the institution to calculate its default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts and SFTs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16Y
section.heading: STC approach or BSC approach: counterparty credit risk exposures, other than those to CCPs, by exposure classes and by risk-weights—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the STC approach or the BSC approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of default risk exposures (other than those to CCPs) by exposure classes and by risk-weights in respect of derivative contracts and SFTs, irrespective of the approach used to determine the amount of default risk exposures; and (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the exposures referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16Z
section.heading: IRB approach: counterparty credit risk exposures, other than those to CCPs, by portfolio and PD scale—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk capital requirements for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all relevant parameters used for the calculation of counterparty credit risk capital requirements (other than those arising from exposures to CCPs); (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the key models used at the group-wide level for the calculation of counterparty credit risk exposures (other than those to CCPs) according to the scope of regulatory consolidation applicable to the institution and an explanation of how the scope of the models is determined, including the percentage of risk-weighted amounts covered by each of the models for each portfolio; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in each of paragraphs (a), (b) and (c) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZA
section.heading: Composition of collateral for counterparty credit risk exposures (including those for contracts or transactions cleared through CCPs)—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of all types of collateral posted by the institution to support, or recognized collateral received by the institution to reduce, the counterparty credit risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs, including contracts or transactions cleared through a CCP; and (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZB
section.heading: Credit-related derivative contracts—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of its credit-related derivative contracts, broken down into credit protection bought and credit protection sold; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZC
section.heading: Risk-weighted amount flow statements of default risk exposures under IMM(CCR) approach—quarterly disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IMM(CCR) approach to calculate its default risk exposures in respect of derivative contracts or SFTs must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a flow statement explaining changes in the risk-weighted amount for default risk exposures determined under the IMM(CCR) approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the risk-weighted amount referred to in paragraph (a) during the quarterly reporting period.

section.name: s16ZD
section.heading: Exposures to CCPs—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a breakdown of its exposures to both qualifying and non-qualifying CCPs and the respective risk-weighted amounts, including—

subparagraph.content: default risk exposures to the CCPs; and
credit risk exposures arising from initial margins posted, and default fund contributions made, to the CCPs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZDA
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 6
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: eligible securitization transaction (合資格證券化交易) has the meaning given by section 229 of the Capital Rules;
non-eligible securitization transaction (非合資格證券化交易) has the meaning given by section 229 of the Capital Rules.

section.name: s16ZE
section.heading: Qualitative disclosures related to securitization exposures— annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, qualitative information on its strategy and risk management with respect to its securitization activities.

section.name: s16ZF
section.heading: Securitization exposures in banking book—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of its securitization exposures in the banking book (regardless of whether the exposures arise from an eligible securitization transaction or a non-eligible securitization transaction); and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the exposures referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZG
section.heading: Securitization exposures in trading book—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breakdown of its securitization exposures in the trading book (regardless of whether the exposures arise from an eligible securitization transaction or a non-eligible securitization transaction); and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the exposures referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZH
section.heading: Securitization exposures in banking book and associated capital requirements, where authorized institution acts as originator—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a breakdown of—

subparagraph.leadIn: its securitization exposures in the banking book arising from securitization transactions—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: of which the institution is an originating institution; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that are eligible securitization transactions; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)
the associated capital requirements of the exposures referred to in subparagraph (i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZI
section.heading: Securitization exposures in banking book and associated capital requirements, where authorized institution acts as investor—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a breakdown of—

subparagraph.content: its securitization exposures in the banking book arising from securitization transactions of which the institution is an investing institution; and
the associated capital requirements of the exposures referred to in subparagraph (i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZJ
section.heading: Qualitative disclosures related to market risk—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, a description of its market risk management objectives and policies.

section.name: s16ZK
