section.heading: Additional qualitative disclosures for authorized institution using IMA—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IMA to calculate part or all of its market risk capital charge must disclose, for each annual reporting period— (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the scope and the main characteristics of the different models used for calculating the market risk capital charge; and (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the key modelling choices adopted in respect of the models.

section.name: s16ZL
section.heading: Market risk under STM approach—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the STM approach to calculate part or all of its market risk capital charge must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period— (L.N. 168 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the components of its market risk capital charge calculated using the STM approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the components referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16ZM
section.heading: Market risk under IMA—quarterly disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the IMA to calculate part or all of its market risk capital charge must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the components of its market risk capital charge calculated using the IMA;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the corresponding components referred to in paragraph (a) for the immediately preceding quarterly reporting period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the components referred to in paragraph (a) during the quarterly reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16ZN
section.heading: Market risk under SSTM approach—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the SSTM approach to calculate its market risk capital charge must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the components of its market risk capital charge calculated using the SSTM approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the components referred to in paragraph (a) during the semi-annual reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16ZOA
section.heading: Qualitative disclosures related to CVA risk—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, a description of its CVA risk management objectives and policies.

section.name: s16ZOB
section.heading: Additional qualitative disclosures for authorized institution using standardized CVA approach—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the standardized CVA approach to calculate part or all of its CVA risk capital charge must disclose, for each annual reporting period, the main characteristics of its CVA risk management framework, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of the framework;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of senior management’s involvement in the framework; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an overview of the governance of the framework.

section.name: s16ZOC
section.heading: CVA risk under reduced basic CVA approach—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the reduced basic CVA approach to calculate part or all of its CVA risk capital charge must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the components used for calculating the CVA risk capital charge under the reduced basic CVA approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of the type of CVA hedges used by the institution, irrespective of whether the CVA hedges are eligible or not as set out in section 322U of the Capital Rules.

section.name: s16ZOD
section.heading: CVA risk under full basic CVA approach—semi-annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution using the full basic CVA approach to calculate part or all of its CVA risk capital charge must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period, the components used for calculating the CVA risk capital charge under the full basic CVA approach.

section.name: s16ZOE
section.heading: CVA risk under standardized CVA approach—semi-annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution using the standardized CVA approach to calculate part or all of its CVA risk capital charge must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period, the components used for calculating the CVA risk capital charge under the standardized CVA approach.

section.name: s16ZOF
section.heading: Risk-weighted amount flow statements of CVA risk exposures under standardized CVA approach—quarterly disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution using the standardized CVA approach to calculate part or all of its CVA risk capital charge must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a flow statement explaining changes in the risk-weighted amount for CVA risk determined under the standardized CVA approach; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the risk-weighted amount referred to in paragraph (a) during the quarterly reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Interest Rate Risk in Banking Book

section.name: s16ZP
section.heading: Interest rate risk in banking book: risk management objectives and policies—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must, in respect of its interest rate exposures that arise from its banking book positions, disclose for each annual reporting period, a description of its risk management objectives and policies.

section.name: s16ZQ
section.heading: Quantitative information on interest rate risk in banking book—annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, information on the impact of interest rate movements from an earnings perspective and an economic value perspective under each of the supervisory prescribed interest rate shock scenarios referred to in the standard disclosure template, in respect of its interest rate exposures that arise from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its banking book positions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the institution is exempted under section 22(1) of the Capital Rules—aggregate positions of its banking book and trading book.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: standard disclosure template (標準披露模版), in relation to an authorized institution, means a standard disclosure template or table specified under section 6(1)(ab) or 88(1)(b).

section.name: s16ZQA
section.heading: General information on operational risk framework—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, the main characteristics and elements of its operational risk management framework.

section.name: s16ZQB
section.heading: Historical losses—annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is classified under section 331 of the Capital Rules as a bucket 2 AI or a bucket 3 AI; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is classified under section 331 of the Capital Rules as a bucket 1 AI and falls within section 332(2)(a) or (b) of those Rules.

subsection.leadIn: The institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its annual operational risk losses incurred over the last 10 years, or a fewer number of years that the institution uses to calculate its loss component under Division 5 of Part 9 of the Capital Rules, based on the accounting date of the incurred losses; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of the rationale for any new exclusions of operational risk losses since the previous disclosure, and any other material information relating to its historical operational risk losses and loss recoveries during the annual reporting period.

section.name: s16ZQC
section.heading: Business indicator and business indicator components breakdown—annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the annual reporting period, including key drivers of those changes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: divested businesses and activities that the institution has obtained the Monetary Authority’s approval under Part 9 of the Capital Rules to exclude from the calculation of the business indicator.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: business indicator (業務指標) has the meaning given by section 323(1) of the Capital Rules;
business indicator component (業務指標組成部分) has the meaning given by section 323(1) of the Capital Rules.

section.name: s16ZQD
section.heading: Minimum operational risk capital requirement—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, information for the calculation of its minimum operational risk capital requirement.

division.name: D8B
division.heading: Comparison of Modelled and Standardized Risk-weighted Amounts

section.name: s16ZQE
section.heading: Comparison of modelled and standardized risk-weighted amounts at risk level—quarterly disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution that uses any of the model-based approaches as defined by section 355 of the Capital Rules to calculate its credit risk or market risk, or both, for some or all of its exposures must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a comparison of the actual risk-weighted amount for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk and operational risk referred to in section 357 of the Capital Rules against the risk-weighted amount for credit risk, market risk, CVA risk and operational risk calculated using only standardized approaches as set out in section 356 of the Capital Rules, as applicable, at risk level; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), an explanation of the main drivers of the differences between the 2 risk-weighted amounts stated under paragraph (a).

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, in disclosing the comparison of actual risk-weighted amounts under subsection (1)(a), an authorized institution must comply with section 359 of the Capital Rules.

The disclosure under subsection (1)(b) must include the extent to which an authorized institution is using the SEC-ERBA (except the use of the internal assessment approach set out in section 266A of the Capital Rules), the SEC-SA or the SEC-FBA for the calculation of risk-weighted amount for securitization exposures if the risk-weighted amount for securitization exposures in the banking book is a main driver of the differences.

section.name: s16ZQF
section.heading: Comparison of modelled and standardized risk-weighted amounts for credit risk at exposure class level—semi-annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution that uses the IRB approach to calculate its credit risk for non-securitization exposures must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a comparison of the risk-weighted amount of credit risk for non-securitization exposures calculated in accordance with section 356(2)(a) of the Capital Rules at the exposure class level against the corresponding risk-weighted amount calculated under the calculation approach or approaches used by the institution for credit risk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of the main drivers of the differences between the 2 risk-weighted amounts stated under paragraph (a).

section.name: s16ZQG
section.heading: Asset encumbrance—semi-annual disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each semi-annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the carrying value amounts of assets on its financial statement distinguishing encumbered assets and unencumbered assets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information relevant to the carrying value amounts of assets referred to in paragraph (a), including an explanation of any material changes in those amounts during the semi-annual reporting period.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: encumbered assets (具產權負擔資產), in relation to an authorized institution, means any assets that the institution is restricted or prevented from liquidating, selling, transferring or assigning, due to legal, regulatory, contractual or other limitations;
unencumbered assets (無產權負擔資產), in relation to an authorized institution, means any assets of the institution other than encumbered assets.

section.name: s16ZR
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 9
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: key personnel (主要人員), in relation to an authorized institution, means any employee whose duty or activity in the course of the employment involves the assumption of material risk or the taking on of material exposures on behalf of the institution.

section.name: s16ZS
section.heading: Remuneration policy—annual disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, a description of its remuneration policy and key features of its remuneration system that is sufficient for facilitating an understanding of its compensation practices.

section.name: s16ZT
section.heading: Remuneration awarded during financial year—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: quantitative information on the breakdown of fixed remuneration and variable remuneration to its senior management and key personnel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16ZU
section.heading: Special payments—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: quantitative information on the breakdown of its special payments to its senior management and key personnel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

section.name: s16ZV
section.heading: Deferred remuneration—annual disclosures
section.leadIn: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: quantitative information on the breakdown of its deferred and retained remuneration to its senior management and key personnel; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an explanation of any material changes in the matters referred to in paragraph (a) during the reporting period, including key drivers of those changes.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Additional Semi-annual Disclosures to be Made by Authorized Institutions Incorporated in Hong Kong

section.name: s17
section.heading: References to authorized institution in Part 3
section.leadIn: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to an authorized institution in a provision of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in so far as the provision relates to a semi-annual reporting period that ends at the close of an annual reporting period, is a reference to an authorized institution to which the provision applies under section 3(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in so far as the provision relates to a semi-annual reporting period that ends otherwise than at the close of an annual reporting period, is a reference to an authorized institution to which the provision applies under section 3(2).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Off-balance sheet exposures (other than derivative transactions)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution shall disclose the contractual or notional amounts of each material class of its off-balance sheet exposures.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), an authorized institution shall disclose the contractual or notional amount of its off-balance sheet exposures which are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct credit substitutes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: transaction-related contingencies;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: trade-related contingencies;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: note issuance and revolving underwriting facilities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: forward asset purchases, amounts owing on partly paid-up shares and securities, forward forward deposits placed and asset sales with recourse; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: other commitments which do not fall within any of the classes of off-balance sheet exposures specified in paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e), broken down into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: commitments which have an original maturity of not more than one year;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: commitments which have an original maturity of more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: commitments which may be cancelled at any time unconditionally by the institution or which provide for automatic cancellation due to a deterioration in the creditworthiness of the persons to whom the institution has made the commitments.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), an authorized institution shall disclose such risk exposure information as is necessary for understanding the underlying risks of the off-balance sheet exposures incurred by the institution.
Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (3), an authorized institution shall disclose the total risk-weighted amount for credit risk of its off-balance sheet exposures, if any.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: original maturity (原訂到期期限), in relation to an off-balance sheet exposure of an authorized institution, means the period between the date on which the exposure is entered into by the institution and the earliest date on which the institution can, at its option, unconditionally cancel the exposure.

section.name: s25
section.heading: General disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose a breakdown of its international claims by major countries or geographical segments in accordance with— (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the location of the counterparties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the types of counterparties, broken down into banks, official sector, non-bank private sector and others. (L.N. 160 of 2014)

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the gross amount of loans and advances to customers by major countries or geographical segments in accordance with the location of the counterparties.
An authorized institution shall disclose the basis of the country or geographical segment classification used for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of impaired loans and advances to customers and, if available, overdue loans and advances to customers, disclosed separately broken down by major countries or geographical segments; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amounts of specific provisions allocated in respect of the loans and advances referred to in paragraph (a); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that portion of its collective provisions which is allocated to any country or geographical segment.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: international claim (國際債權) means the international claim as described in the return of international banking statistics required to be submitted by an authorized institution to the Monetary Authority under section 63(2) of the Ordinance; (L.N. 160 of 2014)

def.name: MajorCountryOrGeographicalSegment
def.leadIn: major country or geographical segment (主要國家或地域分部)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an authorized institution’s international claims, means a country or geographical segment, as the case may be, to which not less than 10% of the institution’s total international claims are attributable after taking into account any recognized risk transfer; or (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to loans and advances to customers, means a country or geographical segment, as the case may be, to which not less than 10% of the institution’s total amount of loans and advances to customers are attributable after taking into account any recognized risk transfer;

def.name: RecognizedRiskTransfer
def.leadIn: recognized risk transfer (認可風險轉移)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means the risk transfer as described in the return of international banking statistics required to be submitted by an authorized institution to the Monetary Authority under section 63(2) of the Ordinance; or (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to loans and advances to a customer of an authorized institution, means that the loans and advances are guaranteed by a person in a country which is different from that of the customer.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Sector information

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose the gross amount of loans and advances to customers, broken down into—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: loans and advances for use in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: property development;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: property investment;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: financial concerns;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: stockbrokers;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: wholesale and retail trade;

subparagraph.name: F
subparagraph.content: manufacturing;

subparagraph.name: G
subparagraph.content: transport and transport equipment;

subparagraph.name: H
subparagraph.content: recreational activities;

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: information technology; and

subparagraph.name: J
subparagraph.content: others; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: loans for the purchase of flats in the Home Ownership Scheme, Private Sector Participation Scheme and Tenants Purchase Scheme or their respective successor schemes;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: loans for the purchase of other residential properties;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: credit card advances; and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: trade finance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: loans and advances for use outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the extent to which loans and advances referred to in subsection (1) are covered by collateral or other security.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution’s total amount of loans and advances to a counterparty type, or to a sector which has been classified by the institution as an industry sector, constitutes not less than 10% of the institution’s total amount of loans and advances, the institution shall, in respect of that counterparty type or industry sector, as the case may be, disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of impaired loans and advances and, if available, overdue loans and advances, set out separately; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amounts of specific provisions and collective provisions.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Overdue or rescheduled assets

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: disclose the gross amount of loans and advances to customers which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: disclose the percentage of its total amount of loans and advances to customers which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that the total amount of loans and advances to customers as disclosed pursuant to paragraphs (a) and (b) corresponds to the total amount of loans and advances for use in Hong Kong, trade finance, and loans and advances for use outside Hong Kong as disclosed pursuant to section 26(1).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the gross amount of loans and advances to banks which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the percentage of its total amount of loans and advances to banks which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of any collateral held in respect of the overdue loans and advances and any other forms of credit risk mitigation and, unless impracticable, an estimate of the fair value of such collateral or such other forms of credit risk mitigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of specific provisions made on such overdue loans and advances.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of rescheduled loans and advances to customers, excluding those which have been overdue for more than 3 months and disclosed pursuant to subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the percentage of such loans and advances to its total amount of loans and advances to customers.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of rescheduled loans and advances to banks, excluding those which have been overdue for more than 3 months and disclosed pursuant to subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the percentage of such loans and advances to its total amount of loans and advances to banks.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose the amount of other assets, broken down into major classes of assets (including trade bills and debt securities), which have been overdue for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: more than one year.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the amount of repossessed assets held, irrespective of the accounting treatment of the related loans and advances.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Mainland activities

subsection.content: An authorized institution must disclose a breakdown of its Mainland exposures to non-bank counterparties, if the exposures are material, into the specified categories.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

def.name: SpecifiedCategories
def.leadIn: specified categories (指明類別), in relation to disclosures for a semi-annual reporting period, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a period for which a return of Mainland activities is submitted by the authorized institution pursuant to section 63 of the Ordinance ends at the close of the semi-annual reporting period—the categories that the institution’s Mainland exposures to non-bank counterparties are broken down into in the return; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had a period for which such a return is required to be submitted by the institution pursuant to that section 63 ended at the close of the semi-annual reporting period—the categories that the institution’s Mainland exposures to non-bank counterparties would have been required to be broken down into in the return.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Currency risk

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution shall disclose its foreign currency exposures which arise from trading, non-trading and structural positions in accordance with the return relating to foreign currency positions it submitted to the Monetary Authority pursuant to section 63 of the Ordinance. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1), the return relating to foreign currency positions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to disclosures for a semi-annual reporting period that is an interim reporting period, refers to such a return for the interim reporting period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to disclosures for a semi-annual reporting period that ends at the close of an annual reporting period, refers to such a return for the annual reporting period. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution’s net position (in absolute terms) in a particular foreign currency constitutes not less than 10% of the institution’s total net position in all foreign currencies, the institution shall disclose in respect of the particular currency its—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spot assets;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: spot liabilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: forward purchases;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: forward sales;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: net options position; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: net long (or net short) position.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), an authorized institution shall calculate its net options position on the basis of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the delta-weighted position of its options contracts; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s internal reporting method.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the basis referred to in subsection (3) on which it calculates its net options position.

Where an authorized institution’s net structural position (assets less liabilities) in a particular foreign currency constitutes (in absolute terms) not less than 10% of the institution’s total net structural position in all foreign currencies, the institution shall disclose that net structural position in that particular foreign currency.

For the purposes of this section, an authorized institution shall convert all foreign currency amounts into their equivalents in Hong Kong dollars as at the reporting date in determining whether its net position or net structural position in a foreign currency constitutes not less than 10% of its total net position or total net structural position, as the case may be, in all foreign currencies.

part.name: P3A
part.heading: Interim Disclosures to be Made by Authorized Institutions Incorporated in Hong Kong

section.name: s29A
section.heading: References to authorized institution in Part 3A
section.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to an authorized institution in this Part is a reference to an authorized institution to which this Part applies under section 3(2).

section.name: s29B
section.heading: Interim financial disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must make interim financial disclosures in compliance with the prevailing accounting standards applicable to the institution.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Additional Annual Disclosures to be Made by Authorized Institutions Incorporated in Hong Kong

section.name: s31
section.heading: References to authorized institution in Part 4
section.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to an authorized institution in this Part is a reference to an authorized institution to which this Part applies under section 3(1).

section.name: s35
section.heading: Annual financial disclosures
section.content: An authorized institution must make annual financial disclosures in compliance with the prevailing accounting standards applicable to the institution.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Assets used as security
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total amount of its secured liabilities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature and carrying values of its assets used as security.

section.name: s46
section.heading: General disclosures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disclose a description of each of its major business activities which is consistent with its internal management classifications;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), disclose a breakdown of its major business activities expressed in absolute terms or in the case of each activity as a percentage of its total business activities; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the breakdown referred to in paragraph (b) is expressed in absolute terms, ensure that the breakdown is consistent with the figures disclosed in the institution’s audited financial statements.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, for each major business activity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), disclose the amount of operating assets of the major business activity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: disclose particulars of the major business activity in relation to—

subparagraph.content: total operating income (net of interest expense);
profit or loss before impairment losses and specific provisions and collective provisions for impaired assets;
profit or loss after impairment losses and specific provisions and collective provisions for impaired assets;
profit or loss before taxation; or
any combination of any of the matters referred to in subparagraphs (i), (ii), (iii) and (iv).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), the operating assets of a major business activity of an authorized institution are those assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which are employed in the course of the operating activities of the major business activity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which are directly attributable to the major business activity or which can be reasonably allocated to that activity.

subsection.leadIn: Where not less than 10% of an authorized institution’s—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: total operating income (net of interest expense);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: profit or loss before taxation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: total assets;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: total liabilities; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: contingent liabilities and commitments,

subsection.continued: is booked in a single country or geographical segment, the institution shall disclose, for the item specified in each of paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e), the absolute amount in respect of the country or geographical segment, as the case requires.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1), (2), (3) and (4), an authorized institution shall ensure that the figures used in determining the breakdown and disclosure of the major business activities referred to in those subsections (including the item specified in each of paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e) of subsection (4)) are consistent with the figures disclosed in the institution’s audited financial statements.

Where the fees and commission income from a product line of an authorized institution constitutes not less than 10% of the total amount of fees and commission income of the institution, the institution shall separately disclose the fees and commission income attributable to that product line.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: MajorBusinessActivity
def.leadIn: major business activity (主要業務活動), in relation to an authorized institution, means the business activity constitutes not less than 10% of the total amount of the institution’s—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: total operating income (net of interest expense);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: profit or loss before impairment losses and specific provisions and collective provisions for impaired assets;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: profit or loss after impairment losses and specific provisions and collective provisions for impaired assets; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: profit or loss before taxation. (L.N. 195 of 2016)

section.name: s47
section.heading: Sector information

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies if an authorized institution’s total amount of loans and advances to a counterparty type, or to a sector that has been classified by the institution as an industry sector, constitutes not less than 10% of the institution’s total amount of loans and advances.

The institution must, in respect of that counterparty type or industry sector (as the case requires), disclose the amount of new provisions charged to profit and loss, and the amount of impaired loans and advances written off during the annual reporting period.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Corporate governance
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the roles, functions and composition of any key committees established by its board of directors including any executive committee, credit committee, asset and liability committee or audit committee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extent of its compliance with the guideline in the Supervisory Policy Manual module CG—1 issued by the Monetary Authority and entitled “Corporate Governance of Locally Incorporated Authorized Institutions”; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: particulars of, and the reasons for, any failure by it to comply with the guideline mentioned in paragraph (b). (L.N. 77 of 2018)

part.name: P8
part.heading: Disclosures to be Made by Authorized Institutions Incorporated outside Hong Kong

section.name: s87
section.heading: References to authorized institution, etc. in Part 8

subsection.content: Unless the context otherwise requires, a reference to an authorized institution in this Part is a reference to an authorized institution to which this Part applies under section 3(6). (L.N. 195 of 2016)

subsection.leadIn: A disclosure required to be made under Division 3 by an authorized institution is a disclosure only in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the institution’s local branches; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s principal place of business in Hong Kong.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Medium, location and timing of disclosure

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and section 103(1), if an authorized institution is required under this Part to disclose information (however described), it shall make that disclosure by— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: preparing a disclosure statement, in the Chinese and English languages, which contains the information;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: presenting the information required to be disclosed in the format, and using the standard disclosure templates or tables (if applicable), specified by the Monetary Authority; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.leadIn: publishing the statement within the following period after the end of the reporting period to which the statement relates—

subparagraph.content: if the statement relates to a quarterly reporting period that ends otherwise than at the close of an interim or annual reporting period—8 weeks;
if the statement relates to a reporting period that is, or ends at the close of, an interim reporting period—3 months;
if the statement relates to a reporting period that is, or ends at the close of, an annual reporting period—4 months; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complying with the other provisions of this section applicable to or in relation to the statement.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall ensure that when its disclosure statement is published—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the statement contains—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all the disclosures required under this Part to be made by the institution for the reporting period to which the statement relates; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a prescribed summary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: neither the disclosures referred to in paragraph (a)(i), nor the prescribed summary referred to in paragraph (a)(ii), nor any information published with the prescribed summary, is false or misleading in any material respect.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall lodge a copy of its disclosure statement with the Monetary Authority before it publishes the statement.
The Monetary Authority shall keep each copy of a disclosure statement lodged with it pursuant to subsection (4) with the register.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (7) and (8), an authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep at least one copy of each of its disclosure statements (relevant copy) in its principal place of business in Hong Kong; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a relevant copy available for inspection by the general public during the business hours of the institution at its principal place of business in Hong Kong. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.content: If an authorized institution publishes a disclosure statement that contains the disclosures referred to in subsection (2)(a)(i), it must ensure that the statement is available for inspection under subsection (6) for at least 12 months beginning on the date of publication of the statement. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 103(2), if an authorized institution publishes a disclosure statement which contains a prescribed summary— (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it must ensure that the statement is available for inspection under subsection (6) for at least 12 months beginning on the date of publication of the statement; and (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it shall not change the means as stated in the prescribed summary by which the general public may readily access the relevant complete disclosures unless it amends the summary in such a manner, and at such time, that the summary at all times states the means by which the general public may readily access the relevant complete disclosures.

subsection.content: Subsections (4) and (5) apply to an amendment referred to in subsection (8)(b) of a prescribed summary contained in an authorized institution’s disclosure statement as they apply to the disclosure statement.

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 103(2), an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must establish and maintain an archive of all disclosure statements published by it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless otherwise approved by the Monetary Authority—must establish and maintain the archive on the institution’s internet website. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: PrescribedSummary
def.leadIn: prescribed summary (訂明撮要), in relation to an authorized institution’s disclosure statement, means a statement setting out the location at which and the means by which the general public may readily access all the disclosures—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which are required under this Part to be made by the institution for the reporting period to which the disclosure statement relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which are readily accessible by the general public (whether on an internet website or by any other means or combination of means). (L.N. 77 of 2018)

section.name: s89
section.heading: Materiality

subsection.content: The chief executive of an authorized institution shall ensure that a disclosure made by the institution pursuant to this Part contains all the material information.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: MaterialInformation
def.leadIn: material information (重要資料) means information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is required to be disclosed under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which, if it were not disclosed or were misstated, could change or influence the assessment or decision of a person relying on the disclosure concerned for the purposes of making investment or other economic decisions.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Comparative information

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution which makes a quantitative disclosure pursuant to this Part shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for disclosures under Division 3, except for the profit and loss information disclosure under section 93 and the liquidity information disclosures under section 103, also disclose the corresponding amounts for the immediately preceding reporting period; (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the profit and loss information disclosure under section 93 and the liquidity information disclosures under section 103—

subparagraph.content: if a disclosure statement relates to an annual reporting period—also disclose the figures for the institution’s immediately preceding annual reporting period;
if a disclosure statement relates to a quarterly reporting period—also disclose the figures for the institution’s immediately preceding quarterly reporting period; and
if a disclosure statement relates to an interim reporting period—also disclose the figures for the institution’s immediately preceding interim reporting period; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for disclosures under Division 4, except for the pre-tax profit disclosure under section 106(1)(e), also disclose the corresponding amounts for the immediately preceding reporting period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the pre-tax profit disclosure under section 106(1)(e), where a disclosure statement relates to the annual reporting period, also disclose the figures for the institution’s immediately preceding annual reporting period and, where a disclosure statement relates to the interim reporting period, also disclose the figures for the institution’s immediately preceding interim reporting period.

subsection.content: Where an authorized institution is unable to comply with subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d) because interim consolidated information is not provided by the institution as a whole, the institution shall disclose the annual figures as comparatives.

Where an authorized institution makes disclosures pursuant to this Part for the first time and it is not practicable for the institution to provide the comparative figures required by subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d) (including that subsection as read with subsection (2)), the institution is not required to comply with that subsection for the first reporting period concerned.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Frequency
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 103A, 103AB, 103B and 103C, an authorized institution must make disclosures pursuant to this Part— (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of the institution’s last financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of the 6 months period immediately after the close of the institution’s last financial year.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Compliance

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall, in addition to the disclosures it is required to make pursuant to any other provisions of this Part, include in its disclosure statement such other information that it is necessary to so include to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information contained in the statement is not false or misleading in any material respect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the operations of the institution are clearly explained.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Part (except section 90(3)), where it is not practicable for an authorized institution to make a disclosure required under this Part, the institution— (L.N. 268 of 2006)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall, after consultation with the Monetary Authority, include in its disclosure statement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a statement that it is so unable and of the reasons why it is so unable; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: information which is the closest available alternative to the information which would have been the subject of those disclosures if the institution had not been so unable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not publish the disclosure statement except with the prior consent of the Monetary Authority.

section.name: s92A
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 3
section.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: ActiveMarket
def.leadIn: active market (活躍市場), in relation to any financial assets, means a market at which the quoted price of the assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is readily obtainable and regularly available from an exchange, dealer, broker, industry group, pricing service or regulatory agency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reflects actual and regularly occurring transactions involving the assets, which take place on an arm’s length basis;

def.name: CashAndBalancesWithBanks
def.leadIn: cash and balances with banks (現金及銀行結餘) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cash in the till;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: demand deposits with banks; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: deposits with banks which have a residual contractual maturity of not more than one month;

def.name: DepositsAndBalancesFromBanks
def.leadIn: deposits and balances from banks (尚欠銀行存款及結餘), in relation to an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means all amounts which arise out of banking transactions owed by the institution to other banks; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include such amounts taking the form of debt securities or certificates of deposit issued by the institution;

def.name: InvestmentProperty
def.leadIn: investment property (投資物業) in relation to an authorized institution, means any immovable property—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: which is not held by the institution—

subparagraph.content: for use in the production or supply of goods or services or for administrative purposes; or
for sale in the ordinary course of business;

def.name: LoansAndReceivables
def.leadIn: loans and receivables (貸款及應收款項), in relation to an authorized institution—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: does not include—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: intends to sell immediately or in the near term; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: designates upon initial recognition as at fair value through profit or loss;
financial assets which the institution designates upon initial recognition as available for sale; or
financial assets purchased by the institution, for which the institution may not recover substantially all of its initial investment for reasons not related to credit deterioration.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Income statement information

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution shall disclose its profit and loss information on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: interest income;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: interest expense;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: other operating income, broken down into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: gains less losses arising from trading in foreign currencies;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: gains less losses on securities held for trading purposes;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: gains less losses from other trading activities;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: net fees and commission income (including separate disclosure of gross fees and commission income and expenses); and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: others;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: operating expenses (broken down if material);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: impairment losses and provisions for impaired loans and receivables;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: gains less losses from the disposal of property, plant and equipment and investment properties;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: profit before taxation;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: tax expense or tax income; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: profit after taxation.

subsection.content: Where a disclosure under subsection (1) by an authorized institution does not give a full picture of the underlying performance of the institution’s business in Hong Kong, the institution shall disclose such further explanation as is necessary for understanding the performance of that business.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Balance sheet information
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose the carrying amounts of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: each of the institution’s assets, broken down into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cash and balances with banks (except those included in amount due from overseas offices of the institution);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: placements with banks which have a residual contractual maturity of more than one month but not more than 12 months (except those included in amount due from overseas offices of the institution);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: amount due from overseas offices of the institution;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: trade bills;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: certificates of deposit held;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: securities held for trading purposes;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.leadIn: loans and receivables (other than those falling within subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii)), broken down into—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: loans and advances to customers;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: loans and advances to banks;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: other accounts (broken down if material); and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.leadIn: provisions for impaired loans and receivables (broken down into those against loans and advances to customers, loans and advances to banks, other accounts if material) which constitute the institution’s—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: collective provisions; and

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: specific provisions;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: investment securities;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: other investments;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: property, plant and equipment and investment properties; and

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: total assets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: each of the institution’s liabilities, broken down into—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: deposits and balances from banks (except those included in amount due to overseas offices of the institution);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: deposits from customers, broken down into—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: demand deposits and current accounts;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: savings deposits; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: time, call and notice deposits;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: amount due to overseas offices of the institution;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: certificates of deposit issued;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: issued debt securities;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: other liabilities;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: provisions; and

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: total liabilities.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to sections 93 and 94

subsection.content: Where provisions for loans and advances or other exposures have been set aside for an authorized institution’s local branches (including the institution’s principal place of business in Hong Kong) and are maintained at the overseas head office of the institution, the institution shall disclose the provisioning policy of the head office including the amount of specific provisions allocated for exposures maintained in the local branches of the institution (including the institution’s principal place of business in Hong Kong).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of impaired loans and advances to customers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of specific provisions made for such loans and advances;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the value of collateral which has been taken into account in respect of such loans and advances to which the specific provisions relate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the percentage of such loans and advances to its total amount of loans and advances to customers.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of impaired loans and advances to banks;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of specific provisions made for such loans and advances;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the value of collateral which has been taken into account in respect of such loans and advances to which the specific provisions relate; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the percentage of such loans and advances to its total amount of loans and advances to banks.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Provisions supplementary to section 94: derivative transactions

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose the total contractual or notional amounts of derivative transactions, broken down into—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: interest rate derivative contracts; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: others.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose such risk exposure information as is necessary for understanding the underlying risks of the exposures incurred by the institution through the institution’s use of derivative transactions.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2), an authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total fair value (after taking into account the effect of a valid bilateral netting agreement) of its exchange rate-related derivative contracts, interest rate derivative contracts and other derivative transactions, if any; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of fair value which has taken into account the effect of a valid bilateral netting agreement.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: interest rate derivative contract (利率衍生工具合約) has the meaning given by section 281 of the Capital Rules; (L.N. 195 of 2016)

section.name: s97
section.heading: Off-balance sheet exposures (other than derivative transactions)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose the contractual or notional amounts of each material class of its off-balance sheet exposures (broken down if material) including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct credit substitutes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: transaction-related contingencies;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: trade-related contingencies;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: note issuance and revolving underwriting facilities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: other commitments; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: others (including forward asset purchases, amounts owing on partly paid-up shares and securities, forward forward deposits placed, asset sales with recourse or other transactions with recourse).

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose such risk exposure information as is necessary for understanding the underlying risks of the off-balance sheet exposures incurred by the institution.

section.name: s98
section.heading: General disclosures

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose a breakdown of its international claims by major countries or geographical segments in accordance with— (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the location of the counterparties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the types of counterparties, broken down into banks, official sector, non-bank private sector and others. (L.N. 160 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disclose the gross amount of loans and advances to customers by major countries or geographical segments in accordance with the location of the counterparties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: disclose a breakdown of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: overdue loans and advances to customers, broken down by major countries or geographical segments; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: impaired loans and advances to customers, broken down by major countries or geographical segments. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the basis of the country or geographical segment classification used for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: international claim (國際債權) means the international claim as described in the return of international banking statistics required to be submitted by an authorized institution to the Monetary Authority under section 63(2) of the Ordinance; (L.N. 160 of 2014)

def.name: MajorCountryOrGeographicalSegment
def.leadIn: major country or geographical segment (主要國家或地域分部)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an authorized institution’s international claims, means a country or geographical segment, as the case may be, to which not less than 10% of the institution’s total international claims are attributable after taking into account any recognized risk transfer; or (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to loans and advances to customers, means a country or geographical segment, as the case may be, to which not less than 10% of the institution’s total amount of loans and advances to customers are attributable after taking into account any recognized risk transfer;

def.name: RecognizedRiskTransfer
def.leadIn: recognized risk transfer (認可風險轉移)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means the risk transfer as described in the return of international banking statistics required to be submitted by an authorized institution to the Monetary Authority under section 63(2) of the Ordinance; or (L.N. 160 of 2014)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to loans and advances of a customer of an authorized institution, means that the loans and advances are guaranteed by a person in a country which is different from that of the customer.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Sector information

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose the gross amount of loans and advances to customers, broken down into—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: loans and advances for use in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: property development;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: property investment;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: financial concerns;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: stockbrokers;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: wholesale and retail trade;

subparagraph.name: F
subparagraph.content: manufacturing;

subparagraph.name: G
subparagraph.content: transport and transport equipment;

subparagraph.name: H
subparagraph.content: recreational activities;

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: information technology; and

subparagraph.name: J
subparagraph.content: others; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: loans for the purchase of flats in the Home Ownership Scheme, Private Sector Participation Scheme and Tenants Purchase Scheme or their respective successor schemes;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: loans for the purchase of other residential properties;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: credit card advances; and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: trade finance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: loans and advances for use outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the extent to which loans and advances referred to in subsection (1) are covered by collateral or other security.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Overdue or rescheduled assets

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: disclose the gross amount of loans and advances to customers which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: disclose the percentage of its total amount of loans and advances to customers which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensure that the total amount of loans and advances to customers as disclosed pursuant to paragraphs (a) and (b) corresponds to the total amount of loans and advances for use in Hong Kong, trade finance, and loans and advances for use outside Hong Kong, as disclosed pursuant to section 99(1).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the gross amount of loans and advances to banks which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the percentage of its total amount of loans and advances to banks which have been overdue for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: more than one year.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of any collateral held in respect of the overdue loans and advances and any other forms of credit risk mitigation and, unless impracticable, an estimate of the fair value of such collateral or such other forms of credit risk mitigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of specific provisions made on such overdue loans and advances.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of rescheduled loans and advances to customers, excluding those which have been overdue for more than 3 months and disclosed pursuant to subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the percentage of such loans and advances to its total amount of loans and advances to customers.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of rescheduled loans and advances to banks, excluding those which have been overdue for more than 3 months and disclosed pursuant to subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the percentage of such loans and advances to its total amount of loans and advances to banks.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution shall disclose the amount of other assets, broken down into major classes of assets (including trade bills and debt securities), which have been overdue for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: more than 3 months but not more than 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: more than 6 months but not more than one year; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: more than one year.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the amount of repossessed assets held as at the reporting date, and the accounting treatment of the related loans and advances.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Mainland activities

subsection.content: An authorized institution must disclose a breakdown of its Mainland exposures to non-bank counterparties, if the exposures are material, into the specified categories.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

def.name: SpecifiedCategories
def.leadIn: specified categories (指明類別), in relation to disclosures for a reporting period, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a period for which a return of Mainland activities is submitted by the authorized institution pursuant to section 63 of the Ordinance ends at the close of the reporting period—the categories that the institution’s Mainland exposures to non-bank counterparties are broken down into in the return; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: had a period for which such a return is required to be submitted by the institution pursuant to that section 63 ended at the close of the reporting period—the categories that the institution’s Mainland exposures to non-bank counterparties would have been required to be broken down into in the return.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Currency risk

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), an authorized institution shall disclose its foreign currency exposures which arise from trading, non-trading and structural positions in accordance with the returns relating to foreign currency positions it submitted to the Monetary Authority pursuant to section 63 of the Ordinance in respect of the reporting period.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution’s net position (in absolute terms) in a particular foreign currency constitutes not less than 10% of the institution’s total net position in all foreign currencies, the institution shall disclose in respect of the particular currency its—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: spot assets;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: spot liabilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: forward purchases;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: forward sales;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: net options position; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: net long (or net short) position.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), an authorized institution shall calculate its net options position on the basis of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the delta-weighted position of its options contracts; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the institution’s internal reporting method.

subsection.content: An authorized institution shall disclose the basis referred to in subsection (3) on which it calculates its net options position.

Where an authorized institution’s net structural position (assets less liabilities) in a particular foreign currency constitutes (in absolute terms) not less than 10% of the institution’s total net structural position in all foreign currencies, the institution shall disclose that net structural position in that particular foreign currency.

For the purposes of this section, an authorized institution shall convert all foreign currency amounts into their equivalents in Hong Kong dollars as at the reporting date in determining whether its net position or net structural position in a foreign currency constitutes not less than 10% of its total net position or total net structural position, as the case may be, in all foreign currencies.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Liquidity information disclosures: general

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must do either of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include in the financial statements or the disclosure statement relating to the reporting period published by it the disclosures under, as applicable—

subparagraph.content: sections 103A and 103AB; or
sections 103B and 103C; (L.N. 77 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide in the financial statements or the disclosure statement relating to the reporting period a direct link to the relevant sections of its internet website where the disclosures referred to in paragraph (a) can be found. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.content: An authorized institution must establish and maintain an archive of all disclosures relating to the reporting periods ending after 31 December 2014 and made by it under the provisions referred to in subsection (1)(a).

subsection.leadIn: An authorized institution must make the following disclosures on a Hong Kong office basis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a category 1 institution—disclosures under sections 103A and 103AB of the average value of its LCR and quarter-end value of its NSFR and the related information;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a category 2 institution that is designated as a category 2A institution—disclosures under sections 103B and 103C of the average values of its LMR and CFR and the related information;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a category 2 institution that is not designated as a category 2A institution—disclosures under section 103B of the average value of its LMR and the related information. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.content: Disclosures under this section and sections 103A, 103AB, 103B and 103C may be presented in Hong Kong dollars or the equivalent amount in Hong Kong dollars. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: An authorized institution must disclose, for each annual reporting period, information relating to the institution’s approach to liquidity risk management that is necessary or relevant for facilitating an understanding of the soundness of its liquidity risk management framework and liquidity position. (L.N. 77 of 2018)

section.name: s103A
section.heading: Liquidity information disclosures: category 1 institution—quarterly disclosures of LCR
section.leadIn: An authorized institution that is a category 1 institution must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following as calculated based on the calculation methodology and instructions set out in the liquidity position return—

subparagraph.content: the details of its LCR;
its HQLA;
a breakdown of the total net cash outflows; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sufficient qualitative explanation for facilitating an understanding of its LCR calculation.

section.name: s103AB
section.heading: Liquidity information disclosures: category 1 institution—NSFR
section.leadIn: An authorized institution that is a category 1 institution must disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for each quarterly reporting period—the quarter-end value of its NSFR including the numerator and the denominator for computing the ratio; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for each semi-annual reporting period—

subparagraph.leadIn: the following as calculated based on the calculation methodology and instructions set out in the stable funding position return—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the details of its NSFR;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a breakdown of its ASF and RSF; and
sufficient qualitative explanation for facilitating an understanding of its NSFR calculation.

section.name: s103B
section.heading: Liquidity information disclosures: category 2 institution—quarterly disclosures of LMR

subsection.content: An authorized institution that is a category 2 institution must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period, the average value of its LMR.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the authorized institution must calculate the average value of its LMR for the reporting period, based on the arithmetic mean of the average value of its LMR for each calendar month as reported in the liquidity position return submitted for the reporting period.

section.name: s103C
section.heading: Liquidity information disclosures: category 2A institution—quarterly disclosures of CFR

subsection.content: An authorized institution that is a category 2A institution must disclose, for each quarterly reporting period, the average value of its CFR.

For the purposes of subsection (1), the authorized institution must calculate the average value of its CFR for the reporting period, based on the arithmetic mean of the average value of its CFR for each calendar month as reported in the liquidity position return submitted for the reporting period.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Consolidated group level disclosures: general
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Division, an authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make consolidated group level disclosures based on the most recent consolidated accounts of the institution as at the publication date of the disclosure statement (being the most recent annual accounts or interim accounts, as the case requires, of the institution);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the institution has a holding company and does not itself publish consolidated accounts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: ensure that the information it is required to disclose under this Division is extracted from the corresponding information in the consolidated accounts of the group of companies of which the institution is a member; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: disclose the extracted information; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if it does not publish interim accounts or only publishes unconsolidated information in its interim accounts, disclose the corresponding consolidated information from its most recent annual accounts.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Capital and capital adequacy
section.leadIn: An authorized institution shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to paragraph (b), disclose its consolidated capital adequacy ratio calculated in accordance with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the prevailing banking supervisory standards relating to capital adequacy issued by the Basel Committee and adopted by the relevant banking supervisory authority of the jurisdiction in which the institution is incorporated; or (L.N. 52 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other standards that are substantially similar to those described in subparagraph (i), (L.N. 52 of 2013)

paragraph.continued: as at the date of its most recently available annual accounts or interim accounts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if its consolidated capital adequacy ratio is not calculated in accordance with the standards referred to in paragraph (a), disclose that fact with its consolidated capital adequacy ratio; and (L.N. 52 of 2013)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: disclose the total amount of shareholders’ funds (being capital and reserves).

section.name: s106
section.heading: Other financial information

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an authorized institution shall disclose the following consolidated information as at the date of its most recently available annual or interim accounts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: total assets;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: total liabilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: total loans and advances;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: total customer deposits (or total deposits); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: pre-tax profit.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authorized institution’s total customer deposits referred to in subsection (1)(d) are not separately disclosed in its annual or interim accounts, the institution shall disclose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of its total deposits (including those from banks); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fact that the disclosure referred to in paragraph (a) is made pursuant to this subsection.
